definition: to embezzle/to misappropriate/to line one's pockets with public funds
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes

sentences.english: Yet poor Nigerians fear that corrupt officials will pocket the savings.
sentences.chinese: 可怜的尼日利亚人害怕腐败官员会中饱私囊。

sentences.english: They all pocket each 50 cents as windfall.
sentences.chinese: 他们都将每个50美分中饱私囊，当作意外之财。

sentences.english: The policeman lined his pockets with bribes.
sentences.chinese: 这警察接受贿赂中饱私囊。

sentences.english: They are always trying to feather their nest.
sentences.chinese: 他们总是想尽办法中饱私囊。

definition: lit. the fat and wealth of the people (idiom); the nation's hard-won wealth (esp. as an object of unscrupulous exploitation)/the people's blood, sweat and tears
to gain from corrupt dealing/to engage in graft/to feather one's nest
to accumulate/to gather/to amass wealth by heavy taxation or other unscrupulous means/(science) convergent
state treasury, also written 帑臧[tang3 zang1]
lit. fat and blood/fruit of one's hard labor/flesh and blood
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
to curry favor/to advance one's career by toadying
